To top it all, a powerful female character is introduced, but she dies within 10 or so minutes after she had been presented. Why would you add a character to your storyline if it has nothing to bring to it?

I also liked the variety of actors in this movie, really international. Some of the things were absurd and unlikely to happen but it was all right. It depicts the actual society in a funny way. Do not watch this movie from a sensitive point of view but try to enjoy the irony about this reality.

No, I am not advertising any video channel, I simply feel this is what director Jesús del Cerro should put after the end of what felt like a glorified, overlong internet video done by an above-average content creator. But should I really be surprised at this trainwreck? Matei Dima, despite having studied acting in the US, is best known as internet funny-man Bro. And I am not even going to mention that weasel Codin Maticiuc's performance--he has no acting studies, nor skills. He is simply a businessman who got bored.The aforementioned actors play the two leads in this movie which revolves around them going to Miami to make some cash and attempt to rise themselves from the poor Eastern European life in Romania. Yet despite picking on Dima, he is, in fact, this basic comedy's only redeeming feature. His acting skills do show a bit, indeed. Or maybe is just because everyone around him acted like a bunch of left-over firewood. Fine, he is not the only one. Florin Piersic Jr., Letitia Vladescu and veteran Mirela Nicolau did a pretty decent job too, I guess.But a movie like Miami Bici really should not be written about in such an overworked manner. With a modest 1.5 million Euros budget, its only ambitions were to get as many people into a paid vacation as possible. But there are great things in movies that are not expensive. Like a great story, an introspective plot and smart, witty, timed comedy. Miami Bici has none of those. There is no social commentary--although there is potential for one--no class inequity, and the comedy, the only thing that is actually crucial, rarely hits. And when it does, it's only because Bro is ready to save the day. While Miami Bici attempts some creative albeit formulaic comedy, most of it falls flat.Take this movie for what it is. A glorified internet video, a piece of effortless entertainment, or a teenager's slumber party's choice for a quick flick while doing anything else except actually watching it. And you should do the same.

If you haven't seen the movie, I recommend you not to take into account the reviews of those who gave a low grade or said that it is a very bad movie.Before watching the movie, you need to know and understand that the jokes will be understood and will only make sense if you are Romanian and have lived in Romania, or if you know the life and traditions of Romania. Otherwise you will not understand and it is possible to say that it is not good.In my opinion, a good movie is when I click play and I don't know when the movie ends. I think it seemed like 10-20 minutes had passed.The team behind this film made an exceptional film, especially with the budget they had. Let's not forget that in America with this budget they didn't even make a Short, not to mention a movie and if they did, it was in category E.The film is a new approach to life in Romania and I think that most of those who saw it (I mean Romanians) found ourselves in that situation, dreams and disappointments.I've seen a lot of movies this year and I can say that this is the best I've seen. All my friends saw it and everyone liked it, I even made a mini cinema in a friend's garden where we all saw it.We didn't even have time to finish our beer, because we laughed all the time. I think that means the movie is good.The negative criticisms are again something typical Romanian that as soon as someone comes up with a new approach we hit them in the head.Well done team and you should make more movies like this. Respectfully AlexH
